Uses of Package
org.tsugi

  • Packages that use org.tsugi 
    Package Description
    org.tsugi  
    org.tsugi.base  
    org.tsugi.impl.jdbc  
  • Classes in org.tsugi used by org.tsugi 
    Class and Description
    Context
    This is a class to provide access to the context level data.
    Launch
    This captures all of the data associated with the LTI Launch.
    Link
    This captures the information around the LTI resource_link
    Output
    A Tsugi application makes use of this class as follows:
    Result
    The data structure for an LTI result.
    Service
    This is for a service entry for services with long-lived service end points.
    Settings
    This is a class to manage settings associated with the link and context.
    Tsugi
    This creates or retrieves the launch data on each request.
    User
    This is a class to provide access to the data for the logged-in user This data comes from the LTI launch from the LMS.
  • Classes in org.tsugi used by org.tsugi.base 
    Class and Description
    Context
    This is a class to provide access to the context level data.
    Database
    This is a set of database convienence methods This is a reimplementation of the PDOX library in the PHP Tsugi but it might not be the best solution since the JDBC PreparedStatement is more elegant and may not benefit from this layer.
    Key
    This is a class to provide access to the key data.
    Launch
    This captures all of the data associated with the LTI Launch.
    Link
    This captures the information around the LTI resource_link
    Output
    A Tsugi application makes use of this class as follows:
    Result
    The data structure for an LTI result.
    Service
    This is for a service entry for services with long-lived service end points.
    Settings
    This is a class to manage settings associated with the link and context.
    Tsugi
    This creates or retrieves the launch data on each request.
    User
    This is a class to provide access to the data for the logged-in user This data comes from the LTI launch from the LMS.
